34669931.review:
[b] Independance Day simulator [/b]

Mise à jour 25/09/17

X-morph, un mix entre un shooter et un tower defense. Ce n'est pourtant ni le shooter de l'année, et l'aspect tower defense n'est pas oufissime non plus. Malgré ça, la sauce prend... et sacrément bien en plus ! 

Pour une fois, on joue le méchant envahisseur et on en fait baver à l'organisation chargée de défendre la peau des terriens. Et ils vont devoir la défendre chèrement cette planète. Parce qu'en tant que conscience avide de ressource, nous avons un arsenal modifiable à la volée pour nous défaire de toutes les vagues des gentils terriens qui ne veulent pas partager. 

Comme cité régulièrement, le jeu aurait pû être développé par Michael Bay, tant ça pète de partout à chaque instant. Et je dois dire que j'ai aimé ça. Même que ça m'a collé la banane à plusieurs reprises. C'est dynamique, ça demande un soupçon de réfléxion et des paires d'yeux supplémentaires pour tout observer à la fois. 

Pourtant, le vaisseau ne dispose pas tant d'arme que ça, et les tourelles, assez classiques : lance-flamme,AA ...etc. Mais le jeu est bien fichu, les petits doublages entre chaque vague font illusion... en gros, on s'y croit ! 

Seul bémol, c'est le ramassage des ressources manuel (via un curseur magnétique ) dont j'ai du mal à cerner l'intérêt. Cela casse le rythme je trouve. 

En terme de contenu, les maps sont au nombre d'une petite quinzaine il me semble. De quoi s'occuper un petit moment, mais pas indéfiniment non plus. Nul doute que le workshop offrira de nombreuses cartes supplémentaires. 

Bref, un jeu qui n'apporte rien de nouveau, mais qui, de part sa conception, offre un gameplay particulièrement jouissif... et après tout, c'est bien ce qui compte ! :)

edit : après avoir terminé le jeu, je reste sur une éval fortement positive. Le jeu de base offre une douzaine d'heure de jeu, sans aucune autre rejouabilité que celle de parfaire ses scores sur les cartes d'origine. Seule interrogation, l'éditeur de map fourni me semble extrêmement compliqué, à tel point que je doute que les moddeurs en herbe y consacrent suffisamment de temps pour étoffer le workshop. Ne pas compter dessus pour du nouveau contenu donc.

34664895.review:
XBOX Oneコントローラーを使用。

[u]タワーディフェンス要素[/u]：拠点（コア）を守るために各Wave開始前の砲台の建築と敵の進行を阻害する為の柵建設。Wave開始後も建設可能だが、敵の進行は止まらないのでお気を付けて。

[u]シューティング要素[/u]：自機で敵を撃破していき、砲台のサポートをしていくのがメインとなる。自機は撃破されても一定時間後に拠点の近くで復活する。ボムやミサイル等自機の攻撃方法は様々だ、これらは下記するアップグレードでアンロック可能だ。

[h1]良い点[/h1]

・敵の進行経路を各種砲台同士を接続することで電気柵の様な物を作成し阻む（変更させる）ことができる。ステージ後半はさながら交通整理を行っているかのような感覚になる。

・タワーデフェンス系でありがちなほぼ戦況の行方を見守っているだけということが無い。シューティング要素もあるので、Wave開始後にも自機を操作し敵を撃破しつつ戦況によっては砲台を建設することになるので常に緊張を保ちつつのプレイが楽しめる。むしろ、自らが可能な限り敵機を撃破しないと砲台だけでは対処しきれない場面が多い。

・「イージー」「ノーマル」「ハード」と難易度設定がしっかりしていて、自分の腕に合わせて変更可能。ゲーム初回開始時に難易度設定を行うが、途中で変更可能なのでご安心を。

・各ステージクリア後にテクノロジーとアップグレードポイントを取得し、それらを使用することで拠点、自機、砲台の機能を拡張、強化することが可能。これらの強化は永続する。

[h1]悪い点[/h1]

・現レビューを執筆時点ではゲーム内の言語設定の日本語項目が何故か「英語」と表記されている。言語で「英語」を選択すると日本語になり、「English」を選択すると英語になるという非常に説明しにくいことになっている。

[h1]総評[/h1]

今作はシンプルでいながら奥の深いゲームで、トップダウンシューター系とタワーディフェンスの良いところを上手く組み合わせた良作になっている。間違いなく定価でも値段相応の価値のあるオススメのゲームになっている。

プレイ動画をアップしているので、気になった方は[u][url=https://youtu.be/YXrBc1p3kf4]こちら[/url][/u]を参考までにどうぞ。

34664363.review:
X-Morph: Defense is a more hands-on game than is typical for tower defense games. You control a ship that can use a variety of weapons for decimating enemies and can also place various types of towers to obstruct paths, deal with particularly nasty threats and make it easier to handle the swarms of enemies the game throws at you with each wave. It all works really well and is incredibly addicting.

I also really like how the campaign isn't just a series of maps with an arbitrary number of waves. Instead, your every success prompts some kind of reaction, giving context to your continuing rampage. It's unexpected in these types of games, but highly welcome!

Highly, highly recommended to all tower defense afficionados. Don't be tempted to play on Hard when starting out as the game puts you through the wringer due to how different this game is from the usual fare.

34657529.review:
I had absolutely no idea that this game was coming out, but I'm glad that it did.  I've been searching for a new, good tower defense game, and this has that, plus some.

Combat as the fighter is smooth and fluid.  There was never a time that I felt as though my fighter was ineffective, or a secondary consideration.  The use of it is a requirement, especially in early waves before you have your more complex tower networks set up.  Each weapon has it's place, and I find myself switching between them frequently to combat varying threats.

Many tower defense games have enemies who are fast+low HP, slow+high HP, fliers.  This one takes that dynamic, and twists it into something that feels more relevant to the game.  Some of the faster enemies can attack your fighter, forcing you to respond to them differently than you do the slower tanks, which simply trundle along soaking damage and heading for the core.  Another quick enemy can jump over your fences, and other obsticles, forcing you to adjust either where your fighter spends it's time, or your tower placement to combat them.  Finally, there are air units which can actually destroy your towers, forcing you to change the way you've laid out your defenses and compromising them at times to deal with the tremendous firepower of the bomber.

If I had a criticism, it would be the variety of towers.  Early on you have a single tower type, though before long they give you the AA tower for free.  Resources are scarce enough that you have to make tough decisions between upgrading to a higher level tower, or adding to the complexity of your maze.  But early in the game, you don't feel like the towers have much variety.  I suspect that opens up a bit as you get access to more resources, and more tower types.

In the end, I'd say that this game is a win.  I did crash once, but I reloaded easily at the checkpoint, midway through the level, and it continued without issue.  It's surprising to play on the side opposing the humans for once, and I'm curious to see if they come up with a "Human Resistance" DLC where you have to oust an entrenched X-Morph force.  As things stand now, if they do it will be a definite buy for me.

TLDR:  Innovative, engaging, plays well, and most importantly, fun.  I'd recommend this to anyone interesting in tower defense, or who remembers Herzog Zwei on the Sega Genesis fondly.

I am not enjoying the game but I dont give a thumbs down because I don't think the devs deserve that.

The game is not bad but the format is just extremely one dimensional. Its is very much a arcade game you play through in 2-3 days and then dont touch again. For the high pricetag I expected more depth and more replay value.

The thing is that XMD is another tower defense game with 8 towers. When I see a free flash TD with 8 towers I instantly close it, there is no way that <10 towers give you any meaningful decisions or strategic depth that is adequate for a full PC release. Every tower has one singular best usage and thats it. Even the extreme simplistic defense grid offers more there. I see that the devs saw the need of adding a upgrade system but it is just scraping the surface. The way it is set up and the contents it havs does not allow for any meaningful choices aside of when you are getting the upgrade. 
This whole mission and upgrade format is extremely outdated and severely lacking in replay value and meaningful choice. 

I get that the starship adds a new layer but I just expect good tower gameplay in a TD.

The game is well done else, the physics are amazing and show a lot of effort going in and everything is polished. The changing of paths with walls is a good concept and I think the jet gameplay with dodging bullets and rockets works well but it just lacks the substance, id rather play any of dozens of warcraft 3 TDs which have enough replay value to play the same map dozens of times. XMD is technically well done and nicely polished but lacking severely in innovation, player expression and creativety. It is not trying anything new aside of merging TD with Shmup and it just scrapes the surface on the towers themselves.

34651538.review:
This game is BRILLIANT.
Congratulations EXOR Studios for putting in the time and effort to make something that is both beautiful to look at while being very well polished, something most AAA games suffer from these days. At max settings the game looks and feels buttery smooth (constant 60 fps) even with numerous projectiles, explosions, and debris flying around the map at any given moment. The game is an utter joy to play. Anyone interested in 'Tower Defense' games should not hesitate to give this game a buy.
That being said:

===Shooting===
The controls are very responsive and moving your ship feels very fluid, no clunky or 'sticky' controls which is great. There are 4 main weapons you can unlock throughout the currently available 14 missions each with a alternate fire that you can charge up for extra damage or utility. Each weapon is best suited towards certain types of enemies (you will be swapping weapons frequently). Blowing tanks to pieces and shooting bombers out of the sky is fun and satisfying and looks increadable. The buildings are all destructable with some of the taller ones being capable of dropping onto enemy vehicles and blocking their path toward your core.

===Tower Defense===
As with the weapons there are several towers you can unlock as you progress through the game. Each having a strength and a weakness. You can also create barriers between towers to reroute the enemy away from your core, making them take a longer route. There must always be at least one viable path to your core however so you cant attempt to turtle or wall off your core. Most of the tower strategy is revolved around choosing the right towers and using walls to reroute the enemy into the longest path toward your core as possible. Destroying the environment can impact this in your favor or to your detriment...

I could go on but i'm sure most of you have stopped reading by now so in short:
Shooting is fluid and responsive, controls are fully remappable, environments are destructable, game looks beautiful, strategy is engaging, game engine is very well optomized, presentation if polished, enemy routes change from wave to wave - the game is brilliant go buy it already

34645577.review:
Usually I am not a type to leave reviews...but this game deserves some attention.

I always loved tower defense type of game. I played it in SC1, SC2, Warcraft...you name it. This game has those exciting elements of classic tower defense--tower upgrades, strategic positioning, route manipulations, etc. On top of that, it has the scrolling shooter aspect where you control an alien aircraft with a bunch of upgrades and technologies. It requires lots of multitasking due to many objectives and various challenges. Some enemies are fast and mainly deals damage, while others are more of slow, yet, tanky types. Some are ground units that have to follow the manipulated path, while some units just fly. Even playing at a Normal difficulty, the difficulty level of this game progresses quite fast and maintains a moderate amount of excitement and challenge. New types of units are introduced just about every wave and stage, so it does not feel very repetitive. 

Plus, this game is just fking beautiful. Graphic is bueaitufuly rendered. Physics look very polished. And I LOVE the fact that objects (buildings) are interactive!! You can destroyed just about anything on the ground and can take cover behind tall skyscrapers like a shield. Just gorgeous.

Totally worth the money. 

10/10

34632124.review:
这个游戏其实很糟糕，虽然宣传视频看上去很美，但是我实际玩到却是另外一种感受。
首先，这是一个塔防游戏，塔防游戏的精髓是什么？造塔抵御敌人进攻，而你要阻挡的敌人必定都是单体性能高于塔的，所以这类游戏最好的方法就是寻找集合点集中布置炮塔用炮塔来堆，但是这个游戏可部署的炮塔数量极为有限，基本上主力输出是玩家控制的飞机，什么鬼
第二，虽然可以用炮塔堵路和变更炮塔的位置这个想法其实是很好的，但是为什么优点反而成了缺点呢？因为这就要求到时间问题了（时间的活），敌人不断前进，而留给你的时间只有这么多，玩家还要控制自己的飞机躲敌人的弹幕和帮助地面炮塔输出，这就注定你没有多余的时间来微操炮塔，这种不足其实是可以靠战斗中暂停时间来解决的，但是这个游戏也没有
第三，作为一个塔防游戏，可用的炮塔就这么点，而且还没有炮塔性能的升级，解锁新塔就完了。但是考虑到塔的数量，主力输出只能是那台小飞机，那么，这到底是塔防还是飞行射击游戏？这种创新已经背离了塔防游戏了（有点偏题）
第四，大多数的升级都弄到了飞机和主基地上，主基地升级其实没啥。飞机的升级，这么多种形态根据不同的战斗切换不同的形态，听上去似乎不错但是这就导致了游戏操作量过大，一个塔防游戏本是阵型布好了就可以慢慢欣赏和缓慢微操但是这个游戏却对手速要求极高，我确定我不是在玩即时战略游戏？
   总体来讲，这个游戏游戏性不过如此，连遭遇战和挑战模式都没，估计制作组经费全部用在环境破坏上了，有些时候画面太过绚烂导致眼睛花也是个问题。而且60+的价格也有点贵过头了，光打第一关南非作战我感觉还是好，但是我看见那惨淡的炮塔升级界面我就瞬间没动力玩下去了。要说价格30+差不多了，同类塔防游戏我更喜欢Anomaly系列


最后吐槽一句，第一关南非大蜘蛛完全可以靠飞机活活绕死，看见那个大蜘蛛的炮塔不停转真的笑死我了2333333   活活被绕死233333333

Après plusieurs mois d'attente, j'ai enfin le plaisir de pouvoir y jouer ! *-*
ce jeu est justte une perle, un jeu indé vraiment bien fini, avec un gameplay jamais vu, je m'explique : 
vous controlez un vaisseau, en mode shooter vertical, qui doit défendre un coeur énergétique. Pour détruire ce coeur, les unité ennemies ont un itinéaire à suivre. Si vous construisez des barrières aves les tourelles sur leur passage, il vont devoir faire le tour, donc ralonger leur itinéraire. Vous avez aussi la possibilitée de faire s'écrouler quelques batiments pour barrer la route et même détruire quelques unitées au passage. Avec les points d'amélioration, vous aurez aussi la possibilité de débloquer de nouvelles tourelles (lance-flammes, mortier,...) et des nouveaux mode de tir pour votre vaisseau (qui par ailleurs change l'apparence du vaisseau pour chaque mode de tir, un petit plus ^^)
Je le recommande vraiment, il y a de quoi s'amuser aussi bien en solo qu'en co-op !

34615557.review:
So this game is basically awesome .. even though (at least according to the leaderboards) I suck at it (probably because I mess around in it too much, whatever).

GRAPHICS: Amazing. Decimation is the name of the game.  Even though it isn't the same, it has a feel almost like they took classic militaryesque  shmups like 1942, Raiden, etc and remasters the graphics from 8 bit to 4k and then some.  The physics engine is great as well; sure it's fun shooting at an insane onslaught of tanks, but it's even better when you can carve the bottom of a building out and knock it over on top of them in full HD detail.  The eye candy is amazing; if you don't believe that, watch a few gameplay videos.  The game speaks for itself.

GAMEPLAY: The gameplay is great.  I have been waiting for the game since almost announce time (I have Zombie Driver and saw their announcement on the steam page for it at some point) and it sounded great, however I know a lot of things sound great on announce and you sit there waiting for months (or even years) just to find out the execution/actual gameplay is terrible, or the game's really buggy (see 'support' below re that), etc.  That is NOT the case with X-Morph.  The only minor complaint I have is I think it would be cool to have more upgrades for stuff like towers and weapons, but I'm getting the feeling that will happen in one or more DLCs in the future.  The game isn't super hard or super easy so it's not boring or overly frustrating and it has that great sense of reward with all the utter devastation (both to the environment and the enemy) you can cause.

This game strikes a nice balance: it's a shmup and it's a tower defense, but it's not one or the other: it can't really have an insane amount of tower defense stuff or it will make the shmup part pointless, and if the shmup part was packed with insane weapons like a classic shmup, the tower defense wouldn't get much use.  Since enemies attack from multiple fronts unlike a shmup where they're all in front of you, it uses a nice balance: use the shmup aspects to clear out the big threats and do precision attacks and use the towers to keep things at bay when you're busy elsewhere.  Exor did very well balancing the gameplay.  

The only part of the gameplay that minorly annoys me is the 'last path blocked' mechanic... it just feels weird that you 'magically' can't block the last path the attackers have (however it's expected ... otherwise you'd just win by blocking everyone out without any effort).  Maybe a system where if you block all path the enemy gets artillery reinforcements that can clear a path would seem more sensible, but it would introduce unexpected behavior since you wouldn't know what path they would clear and it could completely throw off your defense strategy.  The last path blocked thing seems funny, but really I don't know a better way to handle that.

SUPPORT:  I can't say that much for this, but what I can say is this.  I got the game yesterday on release, and in day 1 the game crashed at 3 random times with the same physx error.  I thought this is probably just a thing they missed, it's release day, hopefully it will get fixed soon.  The game is so good the crashes didn't even bother me that much.  Also, the one thing I noticed early on about the game is it only has 12 levels, so  I was worried about how much gameplay you get with the game.  It is only a $20 game though so even then that's not a huge deal.

Fast forward to today, one day after release.  I go to open the game up for a quick morning play and see an update notice for version 1.0.1.  Along with other things, I see:
- Fixed "physx::ProjectionPlaneProperty" crash
- Added Level Editor (BETA - Windows 7 currently not supported in the editor)
- Turned on Steam Workshop support

This means that both things I noticed on day 1 pretty much got clobbered on day 2.  The base game is awesome but I can't wait to see what starts showing up for new levels in the workshop.

Overall, I only really have this to say about the game ... if you're on the fence about getting it .. just GET IT.

34613961.review:
This game is like if Michael Bay directed a Tower Defense game, and it's absolutely glorious. It requires you to constantly rethink your strategy from wave to wave, rewarding you with the joy of overwhelming destruction, and for your crazy maze ideas that let you loop the enemy around the whole map. Visuals are top-notch, I have yet to experience lag, which, given how much stuff is constantly exploding on screen, that's just down right impressive. The game provides a fair amount of the leeway, between the many constant auto-saves, your core has a lot of health, tower upgrades are full refund even when destroyed by the enemy, and you have unlimited time between waves to plan out your defenses. And the bosses. Holy crap I have never witnessed such visual fidelity in both trying to blow them up and watching them run over the city.

Easily one of the most satisfying games I've played.


EDIT: I beat the game, took about 12 hours, a blast (literally) from start to finish. It required me to do some pretty serious thinking and adapt my defense between each wave, which I found very rewarding.

I then reset the campaign and am now attempting hard difficulty. Holy frigin' crap, it's really difficult, I've gotten a number of game overs/restarts and I'm only 1/3 the way through, BUT it's entirely doable. Hard difficulty requires a huge deal of on-the-spot adaptibility, sometimes requiring you to lose a wave in order to see how everything spawns in so you know what to kill first, what you need to run the longest path for, etc. Some of the waves, I thought my defense design was really cheesy cause I had some of the paths practically running circles. Well, as it turns out... if you don't have ALL the paths running circles, you're screwed, so trying to figure out how to do that each wave (and hard difficulty gives you less resources) is very satisfying when you finally pull it off.

Twill edit again once I've beaten it on hard mode. Loving the challenge of the game; it has yet to ever be outright unfair. If your defense seems weak, odds are, there's a better way to do it, and you'll just have to put some good thinking and tinkering in.


EDIT 2: Hard difficulty run took about 9 hours total, along with 6-7 game overs. It definitely requires a much more active use of changing towers in the middle of the wave and knowing when/where your fighter should be. A lot of fun to be had, I still gotta backtrack to try and gold rank everything. Last level felt pretty easy though, the difficulty ramp kinda went down for that level on hard difficulty.

Great game, as a dev from Element TD looking for something new, while I wouldn't call this game revolutionary, it's incredibly well polished. To me, this is the new standard of Tower Defense games!

Just buy the game already, you won't be disappointed

X-Morph: Defense is a blend of Shooter/Tower Defense that is crafted very well.

Game loop - Like in most TDs, you're shown where the enemies will attack from and how many. With your ship you can affect the pathing of incoming attacks using laser fences and the environment. When the wave attacks; you're flying around shooting at enemies in your ship, picking up debri, and building more structures to fight off threats. You can easily switch between fight and build modes. After some waves, the enemy will change the environment or increase the size of the map by attacking from a new location.

What I really like about this game is how well blended Shooter/Tower Defense is in the game. Also the amount of hallenge and pressure. Every level has new units to deal with and they get brought out after a few waves to keep things interesting. 

The difficulty curve of the game has felt perfect so far, each level feels like success or failure hinges on how well I fight and place my towers every wave.

There are even boss units that make the battles feel very epic.

Get the game, you will not be disappointed.
